description: The function 'draw_polygon_with_string_sides' generates an image of a polygon with sides of specified lengths. The lengths are represented as strings and can be labeled with optional side labels. The function is designed to aid in the understanding of polygonal shapes and their properties in geometry.

educational_standards.description: Exhibit rectangles with the same area and different perimeters.

stimulus_type_specification.title: Available Images: Polygon with String Sides
stimulus_type_specification.description: The function can draw various types of polygons based on the number of side lengths provided. The side lengths are represented as strings and can optionally be labeled. The unit of measurement can also be specified. The function is useful in teaching and learning about polygons, their properties, and the relationship between their sides. It accepts a dictionary with keys 'side_lengths', 'side_labels', and 'unit'. The 'side_lengths' key is required while 'side_labels' and 'unit' are optional. The function validates the inputs and generates a polygon with the specified side lengths.

details: 'side_lengths': A list of strings representing the lengths of the sides of the polygon. This is a required field.
'side_labels': An optional list of strings representing labels for the sides of the polygon. If not provided, the side lengths are used as labels.
'unit': An optional string representing the unit of measurement for the side lengths.
The 'side_lengths' list must contain at least 3 items to form a valid polygon.
The 'side_labels' list, if provided, must contain the same number of items as the 'side_lengths' list.
The 'unit', if provided, must be a valid unit of measurement.
The function draws a polygon with the specified side lengths and labels.
The color of the polygon is randomly selected for visual variety.
The side lengths, labels, and unit of measurement affect the appearance and labeling of the polygon.
